Package paoo.game.object

Class ObjPortal

java.lang.Object
paoo.game.entity.Entity
paoo.game.object.ObjPortal
public class ObjPortal extends Entity
Represents a mystical portal object that serves as a transportation mechanism in the game. The portal can only be activated when the player possesses a specific artifact (Pendant) and provides teleportation functionality between game areas or levels.

Portal activation requirements:

  • Player must have a "Pendant" item in their inventory
  • Portal becomes interactive and ready for teleportation once activated
  • Without the pendant, the portal remains dormant and non-functional

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjPortal

      public ObjPortal(GamePanel gamePanel)
      Constructs a new portal object with default properties and appearance. The portal is initialized as a collision-enabled entity with a mysterious swirling light appearance.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - the main game panel instance used for game state management and player interactions

  • Method Details

    • interact

      public void interact()
      Handles the interaction with the portal when activated by the player. The portal's behavior depends on whether the player possesses the required pendant artifact and the current teleportation readiness state.

      Interaction behavior:

      • With Pendant (first interaction): Portal recognizes the pendant, glows in response, and prepares for teleportation
      • With Pendant (subsequent interactions): Portal is ready to teleport, prompting the player to proceed
      • Without Pendant: Portal remains inactive and suggests finding a powerful artifact to awaken it

      The method performs the following actions:

      • Cancels any ongoing player attacks
      • Checks for pendant in player inventory
      • Updates teleportation readiness state if pendant is present
      • Displays appropriate dialogue based on portal state
      • Switches game to dialog state for user interaction
      Overrides:
      interact in class Entity
